column4: [Elsa] : you might want to read up on BASH (the terminal in ubuntu) before getting too deep with commands.  If you want to delete stuff you'd be better off knowing the syntax and what you are doing a little better
Bash is not a terminal. It is a shell.
[Elsa] : be careful with su or sudo commands... they mean super-user or super-user-do  ... i.e. running commands with ROOT priviledges can seriously mess stuff up if you delete the wrong things.
you are right, technically.  but still [Elsa]  should read a BASH manual
